name: Delicious Padisarah Pudding
desc: A popular dessert in Sumeru. The moment it enters your mouth, the springy mouthfeel makes you feel like you're wandering atop milk-flavored clouds. As you savor its flavors, the blended fragrance of Padisarah and Sumeru Rose fills the air. When you finally do reach that very last bite, it feels like something has been left unfinished. You cannot help but lick the back of your spoon, as if to savor the final sublime moments of enjoyment.

value.text: Decreases all party members' climbing and sprinting Stamina consumption by 25% for 900s.

customize.name: Recipe: Padisarah Pudding
customize.desc: A detailed step-by-step recipe for making Padisarah Pudding.

customize.name: Padisarah
customize.desc: A holy and noble plant. The conditions for growth in its environment are very demanding. The flower buds can be processed to make valuable spices.

customize.name: Sumeru Rose
customize.desc: Bright and beautiful, these pure purple flowers give off a pleasant fragrance that will give any passerby pause. While some like to call this a type of "rambler rose," its relative lack of multiple flowers means that it falls under a different floral classification.

customize.name: Milk
customize.desc: Sweet and fragrant cow's milk. Don't waste a single drop, not even that one rolling down your chin.

customize.name: Sugar
customize.desc: A seasoning derived from Sweet Flowers. Has the power to give both energy and happiness.

customize.name: Padisarah Pudding
customize.desc: A popular dessert in Sumeru. Juices are squeezed from the petals of Padisarahs and Sumeru Roses before being mixed with milk, gelatin, sugar, and other ingredients, and then left to solidify. Cute appearance and sweet flavor make it a common sight at celebratory events in Sumeru.

customize.name: Suspicious Padisarah Pudding
customize.desc: A popular dessert in Sumeru. A single bite yields a mix of milky and floral flavors... Which isn't bad, exactly, but remains a far cry from what you expected from this pudding. Did you get the ingredient proportions wrong or something?
